body_html:
The problem is caused by the fact that https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/slim/__init__.py does not export nets.

However, you can get around you problem by explicitly importing nets, adding the > marked line <:

import tensorflow as tf
import tensorflow.contrib.slim as slim
> import tensorflow.contrib.slim.nets <
from tensorflow.examples.tutorials.mnist import input_data
vgg = tf.contrib.slim.nets.vgg
body_text:
The problem is caused by the fact that https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/slim/__init__.py does not export nets.
However, you can get around you problem by explicitly importing nets, adding the > marked line <:
import tensorflow as tf
import tensorflow.contrib.slim as slim
> import tensorflow.contrib.slim.nets <
from tensorflow.examples.tutorials.mnist import input_data
vgg = tf.contrib.slim.nets.vgg
body:
The problem is caused by the fact that https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/slim/__init__.py does not export `nets`.

However, you can get around you problem by explicitly importing `nets`, adding the `> marked line <`:
```python
import tensorflow as tf
import tensorflow.contrib.slim as slim
> import tensorflow.contrib.slim.nets <
from tensorflow.examples.tutorials.mnist import input_data
vgg = tf.contrib.slim.nets.vgg
```
